RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GEORGE pressured the early pace then took over toward the three eighths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn and dug in under steady handling to hold on. BORN TO SIN gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and dug in to take second the final yards while gaining on the winner. EL PACHO set a pressured early pace, dueled at even terms leaving the three eighths pole and contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn, was outfinished in the duel through the stretch and flattened stride nearing the wire. GOLDEN ARROW gave distant early chase, raced near the rail into the turn, angled to the outside leaving the turn and passed rivals in a strong finish. MISSIONARY chased outside, raced three wide on the turn then flattened in the lane. ONE CANDY CASTLE gave chase, raced two deep while between horses on the turn and flattened in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Born to Sin
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,rail turn,dug in for 2nd late,gaining on winner

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: distant chase,rail turn,angled out 1/8,strong finish outside

ENTRY.NAME: George
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,up near 3/8,edge rail turn,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: El Pacho
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met 3/8,dueled even terms,flattened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOUTHERN LAD angled toward mid track while closing to early contention and stalked two deep into the first turn, challenged and took the lead two deep at the seven sixteenths pole, dueled clear toward the five sixteenths, widened at the rail on the far turn and held well under steady stretch handling. AKINGISALWAYSKING veered out and made contact with Stavanger leaving the gate, rounded the first turn in the four path and gave chase from the half mile pole, raced in the six path on the far turn and closed the gap through the lane. CENTRAL PRIDE raced well back off the rail the first turn, gave chase nearing the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the seven path and came along to take third the final strides. SPEAKERIT steadied soon after the start and again off the heels of Southern Lad into the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. GABRIEL'S WING was shuffled back early then hustled inside to catch up to contention, raced in the four path the far turn and weakened in the lane. SCOOTSCOOT set the pace inside, was met approaching the seven sixteenths pole and gave chase from that point, but dropped back toward the five sixteenths pole and weakened at the rail on the far turn. STAVANGER was bumped leaving the gate and never factored. The Stewards reviewed then rejected a claim of foul against the rider of Southern Lad for alleged interference soon after the start, lodged by the rider of Gabrie'ls Wing.

ENTRY.NAME: Gabriel's Wing
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back early,chased rail,4p far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Akingisalwaysking
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out,bumped break,4p 1st turn,chased 1/2,6p turn,closed gap

ENTRY.NAME: Southern Lad
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in,closed to contention,up 2d 7/16,widened,held well drvng

ENTRY.NAME: Central Pride
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back off rail,chased 5/16,7p far turn,along 3rd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligib ility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAKINLIMMARGARITAS took an immediate lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, inched clear at the rail midway on the far turn and dug in under steady stretch encouragement to hold on. KATALIMA stalked off the rail the first turn, challenged between horses at the seven sixteenths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn and finished evenly at the outside girth of the winner. MY SISTER PAM raced off the rail the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced near the rail on the far turn, then flattened stride the final sixteenth. HANNAHS RED RUBY raced in the four path the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and showed little further. WISHING FOR SPRING stalked from the three path the first turn, challenged three wide at the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back past the quarter and weakened. BOCA BIRDIE saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Makinlimmargaritas
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 7/16,inched clear mid turn,driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 98. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. No n-winners Of A Race Since September 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALPHA CHI RHO angled in and stalked from the three path the first turn, challenged approaching the seven sixteenths pole and dueled at even terms from that point, took the nod leaving the three eighths pole, drew clear toward the five sixteenths and held well under vigorous hand urging in the lane. O'CONNER SUNSET settled off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and was steadily handled to hold second. OVERLY CRITICAL stalked off the rail the opening turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, ran evenly in the lane and was gaining on the runner-up late strides. ONE TEN raced well back saving ground, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and showed little more. LIKEABLE rated a short lead inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole and dueled at even terms from that point, but dropped back toward the five sixteenths and weakened at the rail on the far turn. BRISTOL CHANNEL saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: One Ten
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back inside,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Overly Critical
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,rail far turn,even finish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Sept ember 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LITTLE ROO ROO was bumped leaving the gate then stalked from the three path the first turn, challenged nearing the three eighths pole and dueled at even terms from that point, took the nod two deep leaving the far turn and dug in determinedly to hold on. ADVANCE CASH raced boxed off the heels of Auburn Mill through the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced three wide on the far turn and finished well to duel for second. PERSONABLE raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and finished well to take third late. ZEN MASTER rated close off the rail the opening turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. AUBURN MILL took over and moved to the inside to show the way, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole and contested even terms from that point, raced at the rail on the far turn, was met into the lane and flattened later yards. ROYAL PAIN saved ground. MARK DID IT saved ground well off the pace on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn, left the turn outside and flattened stride. SILIPO was never a factor. MILITARY DRILL was forced out entering the opening turn and was through after a half mile. SUBJECT TO CHANGE ducked out and made contact with Little Roo Roo and lost his rider in the process. The Stewards reviewed the start of this race before declaring it official.

ENTRY.NAME: Mark Did It
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Zen Master
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,chased 7/16,rail far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Subject to Change
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allow ances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LORD OF CORK hit the gate causing the rider to lose an iron and after recovering the iron, settled off the rail on the first turn, rallied from the three eighths pole and surged to the lead two deep toward the quarter, drew clear midway on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. REMYS SHOWTIME raced with the early pace two deep, took the lead nearing the half mile pole and showed the way from there, drew clear toward the five sixteenths but was caught approaching the quarter, rounded the far turn off the rail, dug in under steady handling and just lasted for second. CAPTAIN CREED raced two deep the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and ran in the three path on the far turn, finished evenly and just missed second. MINISTRY OF MAGIC raced well back inside on the first turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole, improved in the six path on the far turn then flattened later yards. HOT FUDGE SONDE rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, ran in range of the leaders in the four path on the far turn but flattened in the stretch. YO VINNIE showed little response. BUDDY BUDDY showed little response after the opening quarter mile. CHANGE YOUR LUCK rated a slim lead inside, was met nearing the half mile pole and gave close chase from that point, but dropped back approaching the five sixteenths pole and gave way at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Change Your Luck
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,met near 1/2,chased,gave way rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Ministry of Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back inside,bid 3/8,6p far turn,improved,flattened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING OR STARTER SINCE APRIL 28, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $20,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. No n-winners Of A Race Since September 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DUNCAN IDAHO took the lead toward the half mile pole and set brisk fractions to show the way, raced at the rail on the turn and was kept sharp through the lane. TEACHINTHERELEASE gave close chase through the backstretch, remained a factor off the rail on the turn then dug in to hold second. YOUTHINKTHATSFUNNY gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path, left the turn outside and finished well; widest. DERBY DAY DREAMS gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. BOSS E BOOGS gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. EL LUCERITO chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail and weakened in the lane. SHOWTIME CAT chased, raced in the four path on the turn and weakened. BLACK CANDY was never a factor. SETTLEMENT DATE saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Marshall T and Bentley Donald L

ENTRY.NAME: Duncan Idaho
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: Teachintherelease
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,close off rail turn,dug in lane,held on 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.

CLAIM.OWNER: Dillon Jacob L and Bashaw James

RACE.FOOTNOTES: MIDNIGHT REGRET stumbled to her nose leaving the gate then settled off the rail on the first turn, started a three wide bid approaching the five sixteenths pole, took the nod in the four path toward the eighth pole and dueled clear later yards. MISS ANTIETAM closed to contention and stalked in the three path the first turn, challenged leaving the three eighths pole, dueled to even terms between horses midway on the far turn but was met entering the stretch and dug in to hold second. DALLAS saved ground on the opening turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole, improved her position in the four path on the far turn and finished well while gaining on the runner-up. SWEET FACTOR rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met at the rail midway on the far turn and weakened nearing mid-stretch. HOVEL rounded the opening turn off the rail, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced two deep on the far turn and showed little more. WATERLOO ROSE rated close inside, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Waterloo Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Factor
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,met rail mid turn,weakened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Hovel
ENTRY.OWNER: McCormick Gloria F and O'Hara Vicki
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail early,chased 7/16,2d far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Regret
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled break,off rail early,3wd bid 5/16,up 4p 1/8,drove clear
